availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Hugh H. Martin (Muhlenburgh County, KY, brick layer and farmer)

body.p: Muhlenberg County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Ava Everly Martin on November 16, 1843 in Muhlenberg County. Father of Jas. H. Martin, Mary H. Martin, Robert Martin, and Templeton Martin. Brick layer in Muhlenberg County in 1850. Owned four enslaved persons in 1850. Farmer in Muhlenberg County in 1860. Owned four enslaved persons in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Muhlenberg County, District 1, p. 225A-225B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Muhlenberg County, District 1, p. 117.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Muhlenberg County, District 1, p. 627.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Muhlenberg County, District 1, p. 95B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Muhlenberg County Marriages, Film #000557316, p. 159.
